Name: HTMS Thonburi
Fate: Wrecked in Battle of Koh Chang on 17 January 1941, refitted in Japan, decommissioned and used as  a training vessel until being stricken.
Status: Become a memorial site (deck & front turret) at Royal Thai Naval Academy, Samut Prakan.
Armament:
4 × 8 in (203  mm )guns,
4× 3 in (76 mm) anti-aircraft guns
Before WWII 4 × 20 mm AA Madsen
During WWII 4 × 40 mm AA Vickers
Armor:
Main Belt: 63.5 mm (2.5 in)
Deck: 38 + 25 mm (1.5 + 1.0 in)
Turrets: 102 mm (4 in)
Conning Tower: 102 mm (4 in)
